entries.description: A senior dachshund with thick, yellowish-green eye discharge, possibly due to bacterial conjunctivitis exacerbated by dust.
entries.indian_climate_factors: Dust and humidity worsen the infection.
entries.breed_predisposition: Dachshunds' protruding eyes are more susceptible to injury and infection.
entries.age_considerations: Older dogs have weaker immune systems, leading to more severe infections.

Is there any squinting or pain?
Has there been any trauma to the eye?

entries.vet_triggers: If discharge persists >2 days, or if there's swelling or pain.
entries.seasonal_variations: Worse during dry, dusty months (winter, summer).
entries.prevention_tips: Regular eye cleaning, avoid dusty areas.

entries.description: A Ragdoll cat with increased eye pressure, showing pain and vision loss.
entries.indian_climate_factors: No direct impact, but stress from heat can exacerbate.
entries.breed_predisposition: No specific predisposition.
entries.age_considerations: Can occur at any age, but more common in seniors.
questions_to_ask: When did you notice changes?
Is the cat showing pain?
entries.home_care_india: Keep the cat calm and comfortable.
entries.vet_triggers: Immediate veterinary care is crucial.
entries.seasonal_variations: No significant seasonal variation.
entries.prevention_tips: Regular eye exams for senior cats.

entries.description: A British Shorthair with excessive blinking, redness, and reduced tear production.
entries.indian_climate_factors: Dust and pollution can exacerbate dry eye.
entries.breed_predisposition: No specific predisposition.
entries.age_considerations: Can occur at any age.
questions_to_ask: How long have you noticed these symptoms?
Is the cat squinting?
entries.home_care_india: Use vet-recommended eye lubricants.
entries.vet_triggers: If symptoms persist or worsen.
entries.seasonal_variations: Worse during dry, dusty seasons.
entries.prevention_tips: Maintain good eye hygiene and avoid irritants.

entries.description: Inflammation of the eyelids in a Bengal cat, showing redness, swelling, and crusting.
entries.indian_climate_factors: Dust and allergens can irritate the eyelids.
entries.breed_predisposition: No specific predisposition.
entries.age_considerations: Can occur at any age.
questions_to_ask: When did you notice the inflammation?
Is the cat scratching its eyes?
entries.home_care_india: Clean eyelids gently with warm water.
entries.vet_triggers: If symptoms persist or worsen.
entries.seasonal_variations: Worse during dry, dusty seasons.
entries.prevention_tips: Maintain good hygiene and avoid irritants.

entries.description: A cat showing head tilt, nystagmus (involuntary eye movement), and loss of balance.
entries.indian_climate_factors: Humidity can contribute to bacterial growth.
entries.breed_predisposition: No specific predisposition, but common in cats.
entries.age_considerations: Can occur at any age.
questions_to_ask: When did you notice these symptoms?
Is the cat showing any signs of pain?
entries.home_care_india: Keep the cat in a safe, quiet environment.
entries.vet_triggers: Immediate veterinary attention is needed.
entries.seasonal_variations: Slightly worse during monsoon.
entries.prevention_tips: Regular ear cleaning and vet check-ups.

entries.description: Dog with smelly ear discharge, head shaking, scratching at ears, redness. Bacterial or yeast ear infection requiring veterinary treatment with medicated drops. Can cause pain and hearing loss if untreated.
entries.indian_climate_factors: Monsoon humidity increases ear infections. Water in ears during bathing.
entries.breed_predisposition: Floppy-eared breeds (Cocker Spaniels, Labs) more prone.
entries.age_considerations: All ages affected.
questions_to_ask: How long has ear been smelly?
Any discharge color?
Is dog shaking head constantly?
Pain when touching ear?
entries.home_care_india: Keep ear dry. Do NOT insert cotton swabs. Clean outer ear gently with vet-approved cleaner.
entries.vet_triggers: Smelly discharge, constant head shaking, pain, not improving in 2 days.
entries.seasonal_variations: Peaks during monsoon (June-September).
entries.prevention_tips: Dry ears after bathing, regular ear cleaning, avoid water entering ear canal.
